JSZIPTOOLS API REFERENCE¶

This documnentation explaines all API of jsziptools

Japanese

jz.algorithms¶

jz.algorithms are implementations of deflate compression algorithm is defined in RFC 1951 and adler32 and crc32 check sum algorithms. jz.zlib , jz.gz and jz.zip use these functions. Ofcourse you can use these functions directry.

jz.algorithms.adler32¶

Calculate adler32 check sum.

jz.algorithms.adler32(bytes)¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – Byte sequence
Returns:

number of adler32 checksum

jz.algorithms.crc32¶

Calculate crc32 check sum.

jz.algorithms.crc32(bytes)¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array) – Byte sequence
Returns:

number of crc32 checksum

jz.algorithms.deflate¶

jz.algorithms.deflate(bytes[, level])¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – Byte sequence
  • level (number) – Compression level. Default value is 6. Range is from 0(no compression) to 9.
Returns:

Return a compressed data as ArrayBuffer .

jz.algorithms.inflate¶

jz.algorithms.inflate(bytes)¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – Byte sequence
Returns:

Return a decompressed data as ArrayBuffer .

jz.zlib¶

jz.zlib compress or decompress Zlib compression format files are defined in RFC 1950 .

jz.zlib.compress¶

jz.zlib.compress(bytes[, level])¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – Byte sequence
  • level (number) – Compression level. Default value is 6. Range is from 0(no compression) to 9.
Returns:

Return a compressed data as ArrayBuffer .

jz.zlib.decompress¶

jz.zlib.decompress(bytes[, check])¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – Byte sequence
  • check (boolean) – Validate adler32 checksum if check is true.

Defalt value is false. :returns: Return a decompressed data as ArrayBuffer .

jz.gz¶

jz.zlib compress or decompress gzip compression format files are defined in RFC 1952 .

Example:

var xhr = new XMLHttpRequest;
xhr.open('POST', '/upload', true);

//compress and send.
xhr.send(jz.gz.compress(buffer, 9));

jz.gz.compress¶

jz.gz.compress(bytes[, level])¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – Byte sequence
  • level (number) – Compression level. Default value is 6. Range is from 0(no compression) to 9.
Returns:

Return a compressed data as ArrayBuffer .

jz.gz.decompress¶

jz.gz.decompress(bytes[, check])¶
Arguments:
  • bytes (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – Byte sequence
  • check (boolean) – Validate crc32 checksum if check is true. Defalt value is false.
Returns:

Return a decompressed data as ArrayBuffer .

jz.zip¶

jz.zip pack or unpack zip format archive files.

jz.zip.pack¶

Convert a directory structure is represented in files to a zip format archive synchronously of asynchronously.

jz.zip.pack(params)¶
Arguments:
  • params (Object) – Refer to params .
Returns:

Return a data is archived ArrayBuffer as if you want to run synchronously.

Example:

//synchronous
var packedSync = jz.zip.pack({
  files: files,
  level: 8
});

//asynchronous: run asynchronously if you set "complete" to params_ .
jz.zip.pack({
  files: files,
  level: 8,
  complete: function(packed){
    //do something.
  }
});

params¶

files
Refer to files .
level
Compression level. Default value is 6. Range is from 0(no compression) to 9.
complete
Callback function. This function receive an argument is ArrayBuffer . Run synchronously if you don’t set.

files¶

Files or directories are represented in JSON. Files or directories have a name property repesent filename. Files hava a str , url or buffer property. Directories have a dir , children , folder (Refer to bottom text). Root directory isn’t Object. Use Array.

str
Use string as text file’s string.
url
Load from target URL.
buffer
Use ArrayBuffer , Uint8Array , Array .
dir,children,folder
Use Array and represent directory structure.

Furthermore, you can set level property to Files. This compression level is used in preference than params.level.

Example:

var files = [
  {name: 'hello.txt', str: 'hello world!'},
  {name: 'dog.png', url: './image/dog.png'},
  {name: 'hoge.wav', buffer: wavbuff, level: 9},
  {name: 'sub', dir: [
    {name: 'subsub', dir: [
      {name: 'fuga.txt', str: 'fuga'}
    ]}
  ]}
];

jz.zip.unpack¶

jz.zip.unpack(buffer)¶
Arguments:
  • buffer (ArrayBuffer) – zip format archive
Returns:

Return a instance of jz.zip.LazyLoader

jz.zip.LazyLoader¶

jz.zip.unpack doesn’t unpack all files at first. jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileXXX load files lazy. You can use methods have ‘Sync’ suffix in the worker.

jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileNames()¶
Returns:Return Array of file path.
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsArrayBuffer(filename)¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
Returns:

Return a unpacked file data as ArrayBuffer .
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsText(filename[, encoding], callback)¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
  • encoding (string) – Text encoding. Default value is “UTF-8”.
  • callback (function) – Callback function。This function receive an argument is String .
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsBlob(filename[, contentType])¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
  • contentType (string) – Content type. set automatically if you don’t set.
Returns:

Return a unpacked file data as Blob .
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsBinaryString(filename, callback)¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
  • callback (function) – Callback function。This function receive an argument is String (Binary String).
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsDataURL(filename, callback)¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
  • callback (function) – Callback function。This function receive an argument is String (Data URL).
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsTextSync(filename[, encoding])¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
  • encoding (string) – Text encoding. Default value is “UTF-8”.
Returns:

Return a unpacked file data as String .
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsBinaryStringSync(filename)¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
Returns:

Return a unpacked file data as String (Binary String).
jz.zip.LazyLoader.prototype.getFileAsDataURLSync(filename)¶
Arguments:
  • filename (string) – File path
Returns:

Return a unpacked file data as String (Data URL).

Example:

//create zip
var packed = jz.zip.pack({
  files: [
    {name: 'hello.txt', str: 'hello!'},
    {name: 'sub', dir: [
      {name: 'hoge.png', buffer: pngbuff}
    ]}
  ]
});

var loader = jz.zip.unpack(packed);
//view file paths
console.log(loader.getFileNames());
//view hello.txt
loader.getFileAsText('hello.txt', console.log);
//view hoge.png
loader.getFileAsDataURL('sub/hoge.png', function(dataurl){
  var image = document.getElementById("image");
  image.src = dataurl;
});

jz.utils¶

Utility functions.

jz.utils.toBytes¶

Convert from ArrayBuffer , Array or String to Uint8Array . Return a original data if argument is Uint8Array .

jz.utils.toBytes(buffer)¶
Arguments:
  • buffer (ArrayBuffer|Uint8Array|Array|string) – byte sequence.
Returns:

Uint8Array

jz.utils.stringToBytes¶

Convert from String as UTF8 to Uint8Array .

jz.utils.stringToBytes(str)¶
Arguments:
  • str (string) –
Returns:

Return a converted data as Uint8Array .

jz.utils.load¶

Load files asynchronously.

jz.utils.load(url, complete)¶
Arguments:
  • urls (string|Array.<string>) – File URL
  • complete (function(...ArrayBuffer)) – Callback function.

例:

jz.utils.load(['hello.txt', 'hoge.txt'], function(hello, hoge){
  //do something.
});

jz.utils.concatByteArrays¶

Concat byte sequences.

jz.utils.concatByteArrays(byteArrays)¶
Arguments:
  • byteArrays (...Uint8Array) – Byte sequences
Returns:

Return concated byte sequence as Uint8Array .

例:

//same mean.
var concated = jz.utils.concatByteArrays([bytes1, bytes2, bytes3]);
var concated = jz.utils.concatByteArrays(bytes1, bytes2, bytes3);
